amendment.description: To create a point of order against legislation that would privatize Medicare, cut guaranteed benefits, increase out-of-pocket spending, or turn Medicare into a premium support plan.

action.text: Amendment SA 601 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 601 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 53. Record Vote Number: 90.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305 of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 601.

Amendment SA 601 proposed by Senator Stabenow for Senator Bennet. (consideration: CR S1844-1845, S1870-1871; text: CR S1844) To create a point of order against legislation that would privatize Medicare, cut guaranteed benefits, increase out-of-pocket spending, or turn Medicare into a premium support plan.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 601 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 53. Record Vote Number: 90.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 601 proposed by Senator Stabenow for Senator Bennet.
